assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. DNANexus 1.9.0; FALCON-Unzip v. DNANexus 1.0.6; purge_haplotigs v. v1.0.3+ 1.Nov.2018; longranger align v. 2.2.2; freebayes Illumina polishing v. 1.3.1; gEVAL manual curation v. 2019-09-16; VGP assembly pipeline individual v. 1.5

bioprojects.title: Sylvia atricapilla (European blackcap) genome, bSylAtr1, alternate haplotype
Sylvia atricapilla (European blackcap) genome assembly, bSylAtr1

description.comment: European Blackcaps show large variability in migratory phenotypes (and little else), including propensity to migrate, distance and direction. Blackcaps are a perfect system to study the genetics of migration. This sample (Permit# AZ 3104-4/021/0033, Funding : Max Planck Society, Grant ID : MPRG grant to ML) was collected within the core line of research in the Liedvogel Lab, MPI Evolutionary Biology, studying the genomic architecture of migratory traits, and used to generate chromosomal reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP Project and the B10K Project.
description.title: Animal sample from Sylvia atricapilla

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: European Blackcap sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate haplotype of the diploid genome Sylvia atricapilla. The principal haplotype sequences are in WGS project WNMY00000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
